item.title: D.H.S.’s Role Questioned as Immigration Officers Flood U.S. Cities
item.description: Customs and Border Protection agents deployed a cloud of tear gas against protesters in Minneapolis on Thursday. ]]>

item.title: Under Patel, F.B.I. Scours Its Records to Discredit Trump Opponents
item.description: Under Kash Patel, F.B.I. personnel have worked to paint a damning, one-sided narrative intended to discredit and embarrass federal law enforcement officials who investigated Donald J. Trump and his allies. ]]>

item.title: Buttigieg, Booker Lead Midterm Democratic Health Care Push
item.description: Pete Buttigieg argued that pressure from Wisconsinites had led their Republican congressional representative to vote in support of extending enhanced health care subsidies. ]]>

item.title: Winter Storm Brings Snow and Cold Temps as Far South as Florida and Georgia
item.description: Snow falling early on Sunday morning at a Hyundai dealership in Pensacola, Fla. Snow was also falling in parts of Georgia. ]]>

item.title: Pentagon Tells 1,500 Troops to Prepare for Possible Deployment to Minnesota
item.description: Federal agents in Minneapolis last week. The use of military force on domestic soil in the United States is rare, and it is usually reserved only for the most extreme situations. ]]>

item.title: Islamic Scholar’s Post-Sept. 11 Convictions Are Tossed on Free Speech Grounds
item.description: Ali al-Tamimi, center, outside a courthouse in Alexandria, Va., during his trial in 2005, had his remaining convictions tossed out 20 years later. ]]>

item.title: Noem Denies Use of Chemical Agents in Minnesota Protests, Then Backtracks
item.description: Kristi Noem, the secretary of homeland security, at the White House last week. ]]>

item.title: Man Acquitted of Shining a Laser at Marine One With Trump Aboard
item.description: A Washington man was charged in September with pointing a laser at Marine One, the presidential helicopter, while President Trump was aboard. ]]>

item.title: Josh Shapiro Writes That Harris Team Asked if He Had Ever Been an Israeli Agent
item.description: A new memoir by Gov. Josh Shapiro of Pennsylvania goes into detail about his experience being vetted to be former Vice President Kamala Harris’s running mate in 2024. ]]>

item.title: In Minneapolis, a Pattern of Misconduct Toward Protesters
item.description: Federal agents hold down a protester outside the Whipple federal building in Minneapolis on Jan. 11. ]]>

item.title: San Francisco Mourns Its Beloved Alligator, Claude
item.description: A nearly life-size sourdough loaf depicting Claude, the albino alligator who died last month, was created by Boudin Bakery, in San Francisco. ]]>
